qas.question: Who did Harper Lee become childhood friends with?
What year did Harper Lee pack up to go live in New York City?
What job did Harper Lee start in New York City?
Which state did Harper Lee spend her childhood?
What year was Harper Lee born?
Who was the famous writer Lee became close friends with?
Where did Lee attend law school?
What publishing company bought To Kill a Mockingbird?

context: Born in <a4_0>1926<a4_0/>, Harper Lee grew up in the Southern town of Monroeville, <a3_0>Alabama<a3_0/>, where she became close friends with soon-to-be famous writer <a0_0><a5_0>Truman Capote<a5_0/><a0_0/>. She attended <a6_0>Huntingdon College<a6_0/> in Montgomery (1944–45), and then studied law at the <a7_0>University of Alabama<a7_0/> (1945–49). While attending college, she wrote for campus literary magazines: Huntress at Huntingdon and the humor magazine Rammer Jammer at the University of Alabama. At both colleges, she wrote short stories and other works about racial injustice, a rarely mentioned topic on such campuses at the time. In <a1_0>1950<a1_0/>, Lee moved to New York City, where she worked as a <a2_0>reservation clerk<a2_0/> for British Overseas Airways Corporation; there, she began writing a collection of essays and short stories about people in Monroeville. Hoping to be published, Lee presented her writing in 1957 to a literary agent recommended by Capote. An editor at <a8_0>J. B. Lippincott<a8_0/> , who bought the manuscript, advised her to quit the airline and concentrate on writing. Donations from friends allowed her to write uninterrupted for a year.
